data.oai_dc:dc: Sawgrass Above and Below Ground Total Phosphorus from the Taylor Slough, Everglades National Park, South Florida for March 2002 and April 2004

Once a year during the dry season (Dec-May) three live sawgrass plants are collected from each site. These plants are divided into their live above and live below ground parts. Then both the above and below ground parts are analyzed for TN, TC, and TP.
Taylor Slough|Everglades National Park|long-term monitoring|sawgrass|Cladium jamaicense|TP|Above ground total phosphorus|Below ground total phosphorus|biogeochemistry|2002|total phosphorus|2004
